Audio Description: This enlistment poster is directed to young women interested in a career in nursing. The illustration on the poster is the portrait of a confident young, blonde haired woman looking into the distance. She has blue eyes and red lips. She is wearing a gray uniform jacket with red epaulets. There are silver buttons with a military insignia on each epaulet. On each of the wide lapels of the jacket are silver medical symbols of two snakes crawling up a staff with wings at the top. Underneath the jacket is a white blouse buttoned at the collar. On her left sleeve is the Cadet Nurse insignia of a red cross in a red oval. The letters “US” are stitched in blue in the center of the cross. The young woman is posing on a sky blue background. At the top of the poster are the words: “Enlist in a Proud Profession. Join the U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps. In a black box in the bottom left hand of the poster printed in white are the words: “A lifetime education free! If you can qualify.” In a white strip at the very bottom of the poster printed in black are the words: “For information go to your local hospital or write U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps, Box 88, New York, N.Y.”
Creator: United States. Public Health Service
Description: Poster, 71 x 51 cm, artist: Carolyn Moorhead Edmundson
